intro: Arrhostoxylum stemonacanthoides, commonly known as the Andean spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It has a woody stem with a distinctive, spiny texture, and its flowers are usually yellow or greenish in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
